qas.question: Who erected a number of large stelae in pre-Christian times?
Which stelae is considered the largest in the world, standing at 90 feet?
Who eventually adopted Christianity under Ezana?
Where is the Ark of the Covenant believed to be resting?
In what year was the obelisk of Aksum carved?
In what year did the Aksum become Christians?
In what year was Mecca founded?
How far above sea level is Mecca?
What did Muslims build in the 7th century for religious purposes?

context: <a1_0>The Aksumites<a1_0/> erected a number of <b9_0>large stelae<b9_0/>, which served a <a0_0>religious<a0_0/> purpose in pre-Christian times. One of these granite columns, <a2_0>the obelisk of <a3_0><a4_0>Aksum<a4_0/><a3_0/><a2_0/>, is the largest such structure in the world, standing at <b8_0>90 feet<b8_0/>. Under Ezana (fl. <b6_0><b7_0>320<b7_0/><b6_0/>–<b5_0>360<b5_0/>), Aksum later adopted Christianity. In the 7th century, early Muslims from Mecca also sought refuge from Quraysh persecution by travelling to the kingdom, a journey known in Islamic history as the First Hijra. It is also the alleged resting place of the Ark of the Covenant and the purported home of the Queen of Sheba.
